module.webdavclient.control

Class WebDavClientModule

  • java.lang.Object
    • module.iface.AbstractProvider
      • module.webdavclient.control.WebDavClientModule
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Module, Provider

    public class WebDavClientModule
extends AbstractProvider
    Module implementing a provider for the WebDAV(s) protocol by using the Sardine client library.
    Author:
    Stefan Werner

      Internal element change monitor with regular element checks.

    • Method Detail

      • checkAndLock

        public int checkAndLock(ProviderPort port,
                        java.lang.String[] path)
                 throws ModuleException
        Description copied from interface: Provider
        Checks if an element is already locked and locks it if possible. How this is done is up to the implementation. Should be reentrant (return OK if already locked by this instance).
        Parameters:
        port - the port
        path - the path
        Returns:
        0 if successfully locked, ErrorCodes.EROFS if read-only file system, ErrorCodes.EINVAL if invalid path, ErrorCodes.ENOENT if element not existing, ErrorCodes.ENOSYS if not supported, ErrorCodes.EIO if IO error occurred
        Throws:
        ModuleException - if an exception occurs

      • checkAndSanitizePath

        private java.lang.String[] checkAndSanitizePath(java.lang.String[] path)
                                         throws ModuleException
        Checks and sanitizes a given path.
        Parameters:
        path - the path
        Returns:
        the the sanitized path
        Throws:
        ModuleException - if something went wrong

        Returns:
        true, if exists and is a directory

                 throws ModuleException
        Description copied from interface: Provider
        Creates a folder. If necessary parent folders are created automatically.
        Parameters:
        port - the port
        path - the path
        Returns:
        the result code, 0 = OK, -1 = readonly, >1 = error, 1 = exists
        Throws:
        ModuleException - if an exception occurs

        IMPORTANT: You must still accept incoming calls but try not to make new ones to other modules yourself. Don't (un)register stream listeners here!

                                                   java.lang.String[] path,
                                                   boolean recursive)
                                            throws ModuleException
        Description copied from interface: Provider
        Gets the child elements under a given parent path.
        Parameters:
        port - the port
        path - the path
        recursive - set to true to get all children recursively (relative depth >= 1)
        Returns:
        the child elements (null if non existing/error or no children supported, for example within file elements)
        Throws:
        ModuleException - if an exception occurs

      • getSupportedControlInterfaceCommands

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getSupportedControlInterfaceCommands()
        Description copied from interface: Module
        Gets supported control interface commands. Called from authorized control interfaces to receive supported control interface commands. Answer within Constants.TIMEOUT_SECONDS___MODULE_COMMUNICATION.

        IMPORTANT: Return value SHOULD NOT be null. It is good practice to return an empty Set because null values are returned on call timeout and may be interpreted as module error.

        Returns:
        the supported control interface commands (not null)

      • getSupportedModuleCommands

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getSupportedModuleCommands(Port port,
                                                                  java.lang.String[] path)
        Description copied from interface: Module
        Gets supported module commands for given path. Called from authorized connected modules to receive supported module commands. Propagate to other connected modules and merge result if possible/appropriate. Answer within Constants.TIMEOUT_SECONDS___MODULE_COMMUNICATION.

        IMPORTANT: Return value SHOULD NOT be null. It is good practice to return an empty Set because null values are returned on call timeout and may be interpreted as module error.

        Parameters:
        port - the port
        path - the path (may be null, for example to send more general commands)
        Returns:
        the supported module commands (not null)

        public boolean isReady()
        Description copied from interface: Module
        Checks if module is ready. This does not mean that the module can actually answer calls from other modules. It only means that there is no severe problem that would stop the hole system from working properly. Return within Constants.TIMEOUT_SECONDS___MODULE_MANAGEMENT.
        Returns:
        true, if module is ready

      • move

        public int move(ProviderPort port,
                java.lang.String[] srcPath,
                java.lang.String[] destPath)
         throws ModuleException
        Description copied from interface: Provider
        Moves an element from one path to another within the same port. If necessary parent folders for destination are created automatically. Will NOT overwrite an existing destination element.
        Parameters:
        port - the port
        srcPath - the source path
        destPath - the destination path
        Returns:
        the result code, 0 = OK, 1 = source non existent, 2 = destination exists, >2 = error
        Throws:
        ModuleException - if an exception occurs

      • onControlInterfaceCommand

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> onControlInterfaceCommand(java.lang.String command,
                                                                                  java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> properties)
        Description copied from interface: Module
        Executes given control interface commands. Called from authorized control interfaces. Answer within Constants.TIMEOUT_SECONDS___MODULE_COMMUNICATION. To simplify answering use helper.view.CommandResultHelper.

        IMPORTANT: Return value SHOULD NOT be null. It is good practice to return an empty Set because null values are returned on call timeout and may be interpreted as module error.

        Parameters:
        command - the command
        properties - the properties (may be null)
        Returns:
        the answer/result (not null)

      • onModuleCommand

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> onModuleCommand(Port port,
                                                                        java.lang.String command,
                                                                        java.lang.String[] path,
                                                                        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> properties)
        Description copied from interface: Module
        Executes given module commands. Propagate to other connected modules and merge result if possible/appropriate. Answer within Constants.TIMEOUT_SECONDS___MODULE_COMMUNICATION. To simplify answering use helper.view.CommandResultHelper.

        IMPORTANT: Return value SHOULD NOT be null. It is good practice to return an empty Set because null values are returned on call timeout and may be interpreted as module error.

        Parameters:
        port - the port
        command - the command
        path - the path (may be null)
        properties - the properties (may be null)
        Returns:
        the answer/result (not null)

                  java.lang.String[] path)
           throws ModuleException
        Description copied from interface: Provider
        Unlocks an element at given path.
        Parameters:
        port - the port
        path - the path
        Returns:
        the result code, 0 = OK, 4 = already locked, -1 = not supported
        Throws:
        ModuleException - if an exception occurs

                               throws ModuleException
        Description copied from interface: Provider
        Writes data to an element at given path, creates it if necessary (including parent folders).
        Parameters:
        port - the port
        path - the path
        Returns:
        the output stream to write to (null if read only)
        Throws:
        ModuleException - if an exception occurs
